articles.title: 17 midterm races are still uncalled
articles.description: The 2018 midterms aren't over yet. CBS News political correspondent Ed O'Keefe spoke to "Red & Blue" about the 12 House races, two Senate races, and three gubernatorial races that are still too close to call.

articles.title: Juul stops sale of flavored e-cigarettes in stores
articles.description: Juul, the dominant maker of e-cigarettes, is pulling some of its most popular products from stores. It may have been done as a preemptive strike before the federal government could act. CBS News correspondent Anna Werner explains.

articles.title: 8 dead after deadly Gaza clashes

articles.title: Devastating search continues for victims of California's Camp Fire
articles.description: The Camp Fire in northern California is now the state's deadliest, with 42 people killed. More than 200 are still unaccounted for, prompting survivors to search for their missing loved ones. CBS News correspondent Mireya Villarreal has the latest.

articles.title: New fires erupt in California neighborhood already charred by wildfire
articles.description: Santa Ana winds kicked up in southern California Tuesday. With that, new fires erupted in areas already burned. CBS News correspondent Jamie Yuccas reports.

articles.title: Top White House officials could be leaving their posts
articles.description: Sources tell CBS News Homeland Security Secretary Kirstjen Nielsen will be leaving, but the timing is uncertain. If she is forced out, that could result in the departure of Chief of Staff John Kelly. CBS News national correspondent Chip Reid reports.
